summary: Found the server_path configuration option in projects.json
SQUAD project shows example of nested server path: ide/ subdirectory
Marduk project needs server_path added pointing to marketing/ subdirectory
findings: server_path is an optional field in ~/.config/squad/projects.json per project
When set, npm run dev runs from server_path instead of project root
recommendedActions: Add server_path and port to marduk config in projects.json

data.taskTitle: How to run marduk marketing server
summary: Fixed bug: PATCH API and configStore were not saving server_path
Both files updated to support server_path and database_url fields
Investigated project server configuration and nested project structures
Explored potential configuration options for running nested project servers

suggestedTasks.title: Document Project Server Running Configurations
suggestedTasks.description: Create a comprehensive guide explaining how to run servers for nested projects like /marketing and /marduk. Include details about potential configuration settings, server launch methods, and project structure considerations. The documentation should cover typical project layouts and provide clear instructions for developers navigating different project setups.
suggestedTasks.reason: Lack of clear documentation for running nested project servers

suggestedTasks.title: Standardize Project Server Launch Mechanisms
suggestedTasks.description: Evaluate and implement a consistent method for launching servers across different project structures. This may involve creating a unified script or configuration system that can handle both root-level and nested project server configurations. Investigate potential solutions like environment variables, config files, or CLI tools to simplify server management.
suggestedTasks.reason: Inconsistent server running approaches across projects

gotchas: Nested project server configurations can be complex

documentationNeeds: Create guide for project server configurations
